trans-unit.source: Runs an external program using the ShellExecute API.

seg-source.mrk: Runs an external program using the ShellExecute API.

target.mrk: Runs an external program using the ShellExecute API.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
The name of the file to run (EXE, .txt, .lnk, etc).

seg-source.mrk: The name of the file to run (EXE, .txt, .lnk, etc).

target.mrk: The name of the file to run (EXE, .txt, .lnk, etc).

trans-unit.source: [optional] Any parameters for the program. Blank ("") uses none.
[optional] The working directory. Blank ("") uses the current working directory.

seg-source.mrk: Blank ("") uses the current working directory.

target.mrk: Blank ("") uses the current working directory.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The "verb" to use, common verbs include:

seg-source.mrk: The "verb" to use, common verbs include:

target.mrk: The "verb" to use, common verbs include:

trans-unit.source: $SHEX_OPEN ("open") = Opens the file specified. The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder

seg-source.mrk: The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder

target.mrk: The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder

trans-unit.source: $SHEX_EDIT ("edit") = Launches an editor and opens the document for editing. If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

seg-source.mrk: $SHEX_EDIT ("edit") = Launches an editor and opens the document for editing.
If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

target.mrk: $SHEX_EDIT ("edit") = Launches an editor and opens the document for editing.
If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

trans-unit.source: $SHEX_PRINT ("print") = Prints the document file specified. If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

seg-source.mrk: If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

target.mrk: If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

trans-unit.source: $SHEX_PROPERTIES ("properties") = Displays the file or folder's properties

seg-source.mrk: $SHEX_PROPERTIES ("properties") = Displays the file or folder's properties

target.mrk: $SHEX_PROPERTIES ("properties") = Displays the file or folder's properties

trans-unit.source: See remarks for more information on the default behavior when a verb is not specified.

seg-source.mrk: See remarks for more information on the default behavior when a verb is not specified.

target.mrk: See remarks for more information on the default behavior when a verb is not specified.

trans-unit.source: Constants are defined in "AutoItConstants.au3".
[optional] The "show" flag of the executed program:

seg-source.mrk: The "show" flag of the executed program:

target.mrk: The "show" flag of the executed program:

trans-unit.source: @SW_HIDE = Hidden window
@SW_MINIMIZE = Minimized window
@SW_MAXIMIZE = Maximized window
Return Value
the PID of the process that was launched. Or -1 if there was no PID available.

seg-source.mrk: the PID of the process that was launched.
Or -1 if there was no PID available.

target.mrk: the PID of the process that was launched.
Or -1 if there was no PID available.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
After running the requested program the script continues. To pause execution of the script until the spawned program has finished use the ShellExecuteWait() function instead.

seg-source.mrk: After running the requested program the script continues.
To pause execution of the script until the spawned program has finished use the ShellExecuteWait() function instead.

target.mrk: After running the requested program the script continues.
To pause execution of the script until the spawned program has finished use the ShellExecuteWait() function instead.

trans-unit.source: When no verb is specified the default verb is used. The default verb is the verb configured in the registry. If no verb is set as default in the registry then the "open" verb is used. If the "open" verb is not present then the first verb listed in the registry is used.

seg-source.mrk: When no verb is specified the default verb is used.
The default verb is the verb configured in the registry.
If no verb is set as default in the registry then the "open" verb is used.
If the "open" verb is not present then the first verb listed in the registry is used.

target.mrk: When no verb is specified the default verb is used.
The default verb is the verb configured in the registry.
If no verb is set as default in the registry then the "open" verb is used.
If the "open" verb is not present then the first verb listed in the registry is used.

trans-unit.source: Related
Example
Retrieve the following text file. This can be found in the include folder which is in the installation path of AutoIt.

seg-source.mrk: This can be found in the include folder which is in the installation path of AutoIt.

target.mrk: This can be found in the include folder which is in the installation path of AutoIt.

trans-unit.source: \Wow6432Node
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE
\AutoIt v3\AutoIt
InstallDir
\include\_ReadMe_.txt
Execute the readme file (.txt) with the default editor used for text files in Windows.

seg-source.mrk: Execute the readme file (.txt) with the default editor used for text files in Windows.

target.mrk: Execute the readme file (.txt) with the default editor used for text files in Windows.

trans-unit.source: PID:
